text.p: These are the leading stories in the Malawi press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Vice president of the main opposition Malawi Congress Party, Gwanda Chakuamba, ordered his party's members of parliament to stay out of the national assembly on Tuesday until an on-going boycott of parliament is sorted out with President Bakili Muluzi this week.

- Malawi Congress of Trade Union (MCTU) chief Ken Mhango said a union committee will meet on Thursday to map out contigency plans for a nationwide civil servant's strike should the government fail to meet their demands for a 100 percent wage increase.
- About 150 Malawi troops will join fellow southern Africa soldiers in Zimbabwe for a first ever peacekeeping exercise.
- The Civil Servants Trade Union has called for the immediate resignation of Finance Minister Aleke Banda.
